lines.text: If God ever made two greater inventions than a pretty woman and a bottle of whiskey, I ain't heard of it!
Scalp hunters. The wickedest, crookedest trade to ever turn a dollar.
You mean you want to stay with these, with these heathens?

[to the Indians who are bilking him out of his furs]
You're all right, Two Crows. You oughta be a white man. They'd make you captain of the steamboat and president of the bank. Just because you own this damn country!
What the hell are you standin' there for? Can't you speak English?
No, sir!
Whattaya mean, 'No, sir'?
I mean I wish I didn't.

[walking behind Joe Bass and his horse]
What about me, sir?
I'll just sell you to the highest bidder.
Could you mske that to a Comanche, sir?
You seem to have an uncommon prejudice against service to the white-skinned race!
I don't mean to be narrow in my attitude. Could I ask you what's your name, sir?
Joe Bass.
Well, Mr. Bass, couldn't you kind of consider me a captured Comanche?
[both Joe Bass and his horse turn around and do a 'take']

I came on my own two feet as far as those Comanches. It was my intent to circle south as far as Mexico. The Mexicans have a law against the slavery trade, and since those Indians captured me from other Indians. I have now got full Indian citizenship.
Joseph Lee, you ever study the law?
No, sir.
Well, neither did I, but you ain't got a chance in hell of calling yerself an Indian! You're an African slave by employment, black by color!
You ever fight twelve drunk Indians?
No, sir, but I'd like to see it done.
Go get yourself some clothes on! I don't want these men gettin' any horny notions!
Stop talkin'like a Baptist preacher. If I had half the boots been stuck under my bed, I bet I could outfit the United States Cavalry!

[to Joseph Lee]
Throw you in a pigpen, and you'd come out vice-president of the hogs.

[to the other prostitutes as they realize they are captives of the Indians]
What the hell, they're only men!

[surfacing out of the river and startling Joseph Lee]
Julius Caesar. You're a hell of a dancing man but you sure can't fight.

[watching Jin Howie apparently riding off leaving Joe's furs]
. Don't seem right - that man doing an honest thing.
